episodeTitle: Save Me, Hero!! My Enemy Is the Immortal Princess
description: Usopp battles Perona and her overwhelming Horo Horo powers. Through clever observation and determination, he discovers her critical weakness: her physical body lying defenseless in her room while she projects her astral form. Meanwhile, Luffy continues his fierce battle against Gecko Moria and his shadow manipulation abilities.

events.title: Moria Attacks Luffy with Doppelman
events.description: Gecko Moria, still furious about Luffy's earlier kick, confronts Luffy directly. When Luffy attempts a Gomu Gomu no Stamp attack, Moria's shadow clone Doppelman intercepts it and grabs Luffy before transforming into Brick Bats.
events.significance: Demonstrates Moria's versatile shadow manipulation abilities and his anger toward Luffy for injuring him.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Fingernet
events.description: Luffy counters Moria's Brick Bat swarm attack by stretching his fingers into a net formation. The Gomu Gomu no Fingernet technique catches and smashes the bats to the ground, forcing them to revert back into Doppelman.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's creative use of his rubber powers for defensive and counter-offensive purposes.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy counters Moria's Brick Bat attack

events.title: Usopp's Battle Against Perona Begins
events.description: Usopp faces off against Perona, who uses her Horo Horo no Mi powers. He reveals his weapon Kabuto, ready to fight despite her overwhelming abilities.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of one of Usopp's most important battles in the Thriller Bark arc, showcasing his growth as a warrior.

events.title: Perona Demonstrates Size Manipulation
events.description: Perona demonstrates her ability to change size dramatically, first appearing as a giant form to frighten Usopp, then shrinking to dodge his attacks. This display of her astral projection's versatility leaves Usopp struggling to land any hits.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Perona's astral form abilities, making her seem nearly invincible.

events.title: Usopp Uses Ageha Ryusei
events.description: Usopp fires his Ageha Ryusei (Butterfly Meteor) technique from his Kabuto slingshot, launching a large projectile that leaves behind a trail of smoke like butterfly wings. However, Perona easily evades it by shrinking and flying.
events.significance: First appearance of this Kabuto technique, demonstrating Usopp's upgraded arsenal during Thriller Bark.

events.title: Usopp Uses Kamakiri Ryusei
events.description: Usopp follows up with Kamakiri Ryusei (Praying Mantis Meteor), firing a large explosive projectile that erupts in a green explosion. Despite the powerful attack, Perona's intangible astral form allows her to avoid all damage.
events.significance: Another demonstration of Usopp's new Kabuto techniques, though they prove ineffective against Perona's ghost form.

events.title: Perona Phases Through Usopp
events.description: Perona demonstrates the intangibility of her astral projection by passing her hands directly through Usopp's body, even threatening to grab his heart. This terrifying display shows that while she can't physically harm him in this form, she can create psychological terror.
events.significance: Reveals a crucial limitation of Perona's powers - her astral form cannot physically harm opponents, only intimidate them.

events.title: Perona Unleashes Mini Hollows
events.description: Perona summons numerous Mini Hollows, palm-sized ghosts that swarm around Usopp. These miniature spirits are part of her offensive arsenal.
events.significance: Introduction of Perona's offensive ghost technique, which complements her defensive astral projection abilities.

events.title: Perona's Ghost Rap Explosions
events.description: Perona snaps her fingers, causing her Mini Hollows to explode with devastating force through her Ghost Rap technique. The explosions bombard Usopp, creating holes in stone walls and seeming to blow him to pieces.
events.significance: Demonstrates the lethal potential of Perona's Devil Fruit powers, making her a formidable opponent.

events.title: Kumashi Joins the Battle
events.description: Kumashi, Perona's loyal bear zombie servant, enters the fight and attacks Usopp with overwhelming physical strength. Perona explains that Kumashi's strength exceeds that of a real bear, and the zombie pummels Usopp mercilessly.
events.significance: Adds another layer of danger to Usopp's desperate situation, combining Perona's ghost powers with Kumashi's physical might.

events.title: Sogeking Returns at Thriller Bark
events.description: Facing certain defeat, Usopp calls upon his alter ego Sogeking, the masked sniper from Sniper Island. Sogeking appears to help Usopp in his darkest moment, demonstrating Usopp's psychological strategy to overcome his fear and self-doubt.
events.significance: Marks the return of Usopp's Sogeking persona during Thriller Bark, showing his continued character development and ability to push through adversity.

events.title: Sogeking Purifies Kumashi
events.description: Sogeking shoots a salt projectile directly into Kumashi's mouth, purifying the bear zombie and removing the shadow that animated him. This victory eliminates one of Perona's most powerful allies and leaves her mortified.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's knowledge of how to defeat zombies and marks a turning point in the battle against Perona.

events.title: Usopp Recalls Perona's Behavioral Change
events.description: After Sogeking departs and Usopp removes the mask, he experiences a moment of clarity. An inner voice guides him to recall Perona's behavioral shift during the Kumashi fight, suggesting she must have been controlling her astral form from elsewhere.
events.significance: Usopp's observation skills lead him to deduce Perona's critical weakness, showcasing his intelligence as a strategist.

events.title: Usopp Discovers Perona's Hidden Room
events.description: Following his deduction, Usopp searches Thriller Bark and discovers a hidden door. He realizes this must be where Perona's real body is located, vulnerable and defenseless while she projects her astral form.
events.significance: The pivotal discovery that will allow Usopp to defeat Perona by targeting her physical body rather than her intangible ghost form.

events.title: Usopp Uses Atlas Suisei
events.description: Usopp fires his Atlas Suisei (Atlas Comet) technique, launching four Kayaku Boshi projectiles at high speed with smoke trails. The shots converge together in arcs resembling atlas beetle horns and destroy the door to Perona's room, revealing her physical body's location.
events.significance: The decisive attack that breaks through Perona's defenses and sets up Usopp's victory in the next episode.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy counters Moria's Brick Bat attack with a net of stretched fingers

themes.description: Usopp's battle with Perona represents his struggle to overcome overwhelming odds through observation, intelligence, and inner strength. The return of Sogeking symbolizes his ability to push past fear.
themes.symbolism: Sogeking serves as Usopp's psychological armor, allowing him to access courage he doesn't believe he naturally possesses.

themes.description: Rather than defeating Perona through brute force, Usopp must use his observational skills and deductive reasoning to find her weakness. This emphasizes that battles can be won through strategy.
themes.symbolism: The hidden room represents the truth behind illusions - what appears invincible often has a hidden vulnerability.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates growth as both a warrior and strategist, using intelligence and observation to overcome Perona's seemingly invincible powers. His return to the Sogeking persona shows his continued psychological complexity.
keyActions: Uses new Kabuto techniques against Perona
Calls upon Sogeking to purify Kumashi
Uses Atlas Suisei to break through the door

characterSpotlights.development: Perona's confidence in her invincibility begins to crack as Usopp proves more resourceful than expected. Her arrogance and reliance on her astral form becomes her downfall.
keyActions: Phases through Usopp to intimidate him
Unleashes Mini Hollows and Ghost Rap

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences between Usopp and Perona, adding more visual demonstrations of her powers and his techniques compared to the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the return of Usopp's Sogeking persona, which he previously used during the Enies Lobby arc.
Episode 360 adapts Chapter 465 of the manga, covering pages 2-19.
The Atlas Suisei technique is named after the Atlas beetle, with the four converging shots resembling the beetle's distinctive horns.
